qas.question: What grows in abundance in areas such as the meadows above the Lauterbrunnental?

answers.text: Alpine plants such the Alpine gentian

qas.question: How many species of the early-spring blooming flower grow in the Alps?

context: <a0_0>Alpine plants such the Alpine gentian<a0_0/> grow in abundance in areas such as the meadows above the Lauterbrunnental. Gentians are named after <a1_0>the Illyrian king Gentius<a1_0/>, and <a2_0>40 species<a2_0/> of the early-spring blooming flower grow in the Alps, in a range of 1,500 to 2,400 m (4,921 to 7,874 ft). Writing about the gentians in Switzerland D. H. Lawrence described them as "darkening the day-time, torch-like with the smoking blueness of Pluto's gloom." Gentians tend to "appear" repeatedly as the spring blooming takes place at progressively later dates, moving from the lower altitude to the higher altitude meadows where the snow melts much later than in the valleys. On the highest rocky ledges the spring flowers bloom in the summer.
